title: Somewhat Positive Media Coverage Somewhat Unlikely to Affect Strattec Security (STRT) Stock Price
content: Media headlines about Strattec Security (NASDAQ:STRT) have trended somewhat positive this week, Accern Sentiment reports. The research group scores the sentiment of press coverage by reviewing more than 20 million news and blog sources. Accern ranks coverage of public companies on a scale of -1 to 1, with scores nearest to one being the most favorable. Strattec Security earned a news sentiment score of 0.18 on Accern’s scale. Accern also gave media headlines about the auto parts company an impact score of 46.8899533775965 out of 100, meaning that recent press coverage is somewhat unlikely to have an effect on the company’s share price in the next several days.    Shares of Strattec Security stock traded up $0.20 during trading hours on Friday, reaching $38.20. The stock had a trading volume of 12,345 shares, compared to its average volume of 9,897. The company has a market cap of $141.31 million, a price-to-earnings ratio of 13.25 and a beta of 1.47. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.26, a current ratio of 2.06 and a quick ratio of 1.46. Strattec Security has a 1 year low of $30.05 and a 1 year high of $49.20.    Get Strattec Security alerts:      Strattec Security (NASDAQ:STRT) last released its quarterly earnings data on Thursday, April 26th. The auto parts company reported $0.80 EPS for the quarter, topping analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.62 by $0.18. The company had revenue of $116.82 million for the quarter. Strattec Security had a return on equity of 6.02% and a net margin of 2.34%.    The company also recently disclosed a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Friday, June 29th. Stockholders of record on Friday, June 15th will be issued a $0.14 dividend. The ex-dividend date is Thursday, June 14th. This represents a $0.56 dividend on an annualized basis and a dividend yield of 1.47%.  Separately, ValuEngine downgraded Strattec Security from a “strong-buy” rating to a “buy” rating in a report on Monday, April 2nd.    About Strattec Security    Strattec Security Corporation engages in the design, development, manufacture, and marketing of automotive access control products under the VAST brand primarily in the United States. The company offers mechanical locks and keys, electronically enhanced locks and keys, steering column and instrument panel ignition lock housings, latches, power sliding side door systems, power lift gate systems, power deck lid systems, door handles, and related products.
